page.title: 12PORT OF MENTEITH FARMING
page.content: Farming is restricted to the northern,eastern and south eastern shores of the Lake. On the northern shore it is a narrow strip,about two fields wide which slopes quickly on to hill grazing. At the eastern end the land is flatter and better for farming. Here grass,both for feeding cattle,in the form of silage or hay and as a cash crop is grown. Also some barley and oats. At the south eastern corner there is a little more emphasis on crop growing,barley,winter wheat,maize and of course grass for silage and hay. The animals bred are sheep and beef cattle. Silage is made by mixing grass and treacle and storing in a covered pit for 5_6 months before use.
